post_text:
From Palo Verde High School Principal Mrs. Rachel Angel:

Welcome to our Virtual Back to School Night for Palo Verde High School! Watch the informational videos on pvhs.pvusd.us, from your student’s google classroom or from one of our social media sites on Facebook (PVHS-Stinger-School Newspaper), Instagram (pvyellowjackets) or Twitter (@pvyellowjackets). Our administrators, teachers and counselors will be available to answer questions from 6 to 7 pm via emails.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YmIp7b61iaAi-LyCpqJxIVCCId63_f2jk1cYyuhBVrY/edit?usp=sharing

¡Bienvenidos a nuestra Noche Virtual de Regreso a Clases para la Escuela Secundaria Palo Verde! Mire los videos informativos en pvhs.pvusd.us, desde el aula de Google de su estudiante o desde uno de nuestros sitios de redes sociales en Facebook (PVHS-Stinger-School Newspaper), Instagram (pvyellowjackets) o Twitter (@pvyellowjackets). Nuestros administradores, maestros y consejeros estarán disponibles para responder preguntas de 6 a 7 pm por correo electrónico.

post_text:
Parents,

It was brought to our attention that our community has the impression that students who enroll in the Teacher-Led Distance Learning will only have access to online services.

PLEASE BE AWARE that district teachers will be available for support. The students who are enrolled in our district and choose Teacher-Led Distance Learning will have one of our teachers for support.

Please get this word out. Our online program is very complete and our teachers are leading the learning. We are confident that it will meet the learning needs of our students.

Common issue #2 that parents are having:

When you ask for a password reset, the system says your email is not in the system. If this happens, please email contactus@pvusd.us with your name and your child's name in the email. We can add the email to your child's account.

post_text:
Greetings, PVUSD Community!

The district is working diligently to provide safe educational options for our students when they return to learn in August. We are making available to our community, a second informational flyer describing our Triad model. Please see the informational flyer posted on our district and school websites.

PVUSD has updated our website to provide easier access to our community regarding information related to school reopening, as well as enrolling and registering students for school. To find the updates, please refer to the dashboard links, "Return to Learn" and "Enrollment & Registration.” Please note that you may need to refresh the website page to see the updates.

Tomorrow, we will distribute our second “Frequently Asked Questions” to you through our website and through social media platforms. We are compiling frequently asked questions from our community so we can provide you answers to these questions.

We are here to serve our students and their families and we hope you are having a safe and healthy summer.

PVUSD Administration
text:
Greetings, PVUSD Community!

The district is working diligently to provide safe educational options for our students when they return to learn in August. We are making available to our community, a second informational flyer describing our Triad model. Please see the informational flyer posted on our district and school websites.

PVUSD has updated our website to provide easier access to our community regarding information related to school reopening, as well as enrolling and registering students for school. To find the updates, please refer to the dashboard links, "Return to Learn" and "Enrollment & Registration.” Please note that you may need to refresh the website page to see the updates.

Tomorrow, we will distribute our second “Frequently Asked Questions” to you through our website and through social media platforms. We are compiling frequently asked questions from our community so we can provide you answers to these questions.

We are here to serve our students and their families and we hope you are having a safe and healthy summer.

PVUSD Administration

Parents and guardians, it is time to enroll your new PVUSD students!!!

Aeries Online Enrollment

This website is the first step in enrolling new students to Palo Verde Unified and allows you to quickly start the process of enrolling your student in school. Information about the student such as emergency contacts, medical and language information will be collected. This is for NEW ENROLLEES ONLY, registration will occur separately.

:Use the link below to begin the online enrollment process:

https://paloverdeusd.asp.aeries.net/air/

The Riverside County Office of Education and California PTA are excited to welcome you to our 2020 Virtual Parent Summit from May 25-29. During this unique event, key experts in the field discuss the current impact of the COVID-19 Pandemic and offer strategies, solutions and perspective to assist students during this sustained crisis.

More information:
https://parentvirtualsummit.weebly.com/

post_text:
PVHS Spirit Week - Theme: PVHS Loves Class of 2020

Monday 6/1/2020 - 2020 Love Monday (Decorate your car windows, house windows, front yards, or business with signs/writings celebrating the Class of 2020’s graduates)

Tuesday 6/2/2020 - Shout out Tuesday (Post a photo, or video on social media expressing congratulations to the Class of 2020)

Wednesday 6/3/2020 - Signing Day Wednesday (Class of 2020 posts via social media the college they will attend/the military branch they are enlisted to/the career path they have committed to)

Thursday 6/4/2020 - Throwback Thursday (Class of 2020 posts via social media their baby/childhood photos; the community in honor of the Class of 2020 will post their graduation picture)

Friday 6/5/2020 - Green & Gold Graduation Friday (Class of 2020 via social media will post a picture wearing their cap and gown; the community will honor the Class of 2020 by wearing Green & or Gold)

post_text:
Happy Friday PVUSD students and families!

Student grab-and-go meals will be distributed on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday of next week. The meal distribution location at Margaret White Cafeteria will be changed to a bus stop grab-and-go meal location beginning Monday.

Please visit our district website at pvusd.us, for links to access all of our schools' websites. All school websites are live and updated. Principals will begin communicating their plans for 8th grade promotion and high school graduation through our local radio station, social media platforms, letters home to graduates, and on our websites.

PVUSD students, please continue to work on your extra credit packets and read everyday! Stay safe by staying in place, covering your face and keeping your space.

Have a wonderful and safe weekend.

PVUSD Administration

PVUSD Administration

post_text:
Happy Monday PVUSD community,

Elementary extra credit packets were collected and new packets handed out today. Please see your school's website and social media platforms for more information.

School meals were distributed today, and will be distributed on Tuesday and Thursday this week. Visit our district website at pvusd.us for updated learning packets, COVID-19 information, and an updated art lesson for families entitled, "Watercolor Painting".

The public health order for school closures is still in effect. Social gatherings are restricted under the Governor's public health order, and face coverings and social distancing are strongly recommended.

We hope you had a safe and enjoyable Mother's Day weekend.

Have a good evening.

PVUSD Administration

Have a good evening.

PVUSD Administration

post_text:
Hello PVUSD community and Happy Thursday evening.

A reminder that there will be no school lunches distributed tomorrow. Friday’s meals were distributed with today's meals. Next week, school meals will be provided on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday.

Extra credit learning packets for Palo Verde High School are due tomorrow by 3 p.m. On Monday, elementary schools will be collecting and delivering extra credit packets. Elementary schools will be communicating their schedules with you. Also, information can be found on school social media sites and school websites. Visit pvusd.us for links to the elementary websites.

Thank you, and we hope you have a good weekend.

PVUSD Administration

post_text:
Good afternoon PVUSD Community,

We would like to recognize our wonderful teachers today for National Teacher Appreciation Day. Thank you for all you do for our students and community each and every day. Teachers ask that their students continue to read every day, and participate with the extra credit learning assignments.

Today's Grab-and-Go student meals included today’s meal and Wednesday's meal, so there will be no meals distributed tomorrow. On Thursday, Grab-and-go meals will include Thursday’s and Friday's meals, so the last Grab-and-Go meals distributed for this week will be on Thursday. Next week, school meals will be distributed on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday.

Please visit our district website at pvusd.us or see our district Facebook page for a virtual link to our school board meeting tonight. Open session begins at 6:00 pm.

Tune in tomorrow evening to our local radio station, KJMB, to hear school and district updates.

Have a good rest of your day.

PVUSD Administration

post_text:
Hello PVUSD Community,

We want to thank our families and teachers for getting extra credit learning packets out successfully to our elementary students. Elementary school websites are being launched where online access is available for the extra credit packets. A reminder that the extra credit assignments for Palo Verde High School are due every Friday by 3 p.m.

On Monday, Tuesday and Thursday of next week, school grab-and-go meals will be distributed. Wednesday’s meals will be included with Tuesday's meal distribution and Friday’s meals will be included with Thursday's meal distribution.

Beginning next week messages from the district will go out once or twice weekly. Schools will also provide information to their students and families.

PVUSD appreciates our wonderful, hard-working school principals on National School Principal Day! Thank you for your dedication to our students and their learning and well-being.

Have a great evening and a wonderful weekend.

PVUSD Administration

post_text: Today is National School Principals' Day! PVUSD has the best principals and we want to thank these educational leaders for all they do for their students, staff, parents ,and the community! Thank you, April Smith, Cintia Robinson, Judy Browder, Karina de la Pena, and Rachel Angel!
text: Today is National School Principals' Day! PVUSD has the best principals and we want to thank these educational leaders for all they do for their students, staff, parents ,and the community! Thank you, April Smith, Cintia Robinson, Judy Browder, Karina de la Pena, and Rachel Angel!

post_text:
Greetings PVUSD families,

Thank you for your support picking up learning packets today at the elementary schools. All three elementary schools and Head Start will be having another drive through learning packet pick up day tomorrow.

Look for your elementary school's new website going 'live' tomorrow. Visit the district website at www.pvusd.us for links to the school websites. The school websites will have the learning packets online.

Grab-and-go lunches will be distributed on three days next week - Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday.

Have a great evening.

PVUSD Administration

post_text:
Hello PVUSD families,

As a reminder our elementary schools and Head Start Preschool will be providing learning packets for our students this week. Elementary learning packets will be for extra credit. Students will be able to increase their grades through the extra credit packets that will go out on Thursday and Friday from each elementary school site. Your child’s elementary school will be providing important information regarding packet pick up times and schedules. Each school has its own packet pick up schedule, so check your school’s social media page for information.

Listen to our local radio station, KJMB, this evening for information related to Head Start and elementary learning packet pick up times at our schools.

Tomorrow, student grab-and-go meals will include meals for Thursday and Friday.

Please continue to wear masks and face coverings when picking up students’ meals and learning packets.

Thanks for your support and have a wonderful evening.

PVUSD Administration

post_text:
Happy Monday PVUSD students, families and staff,

We hope you had a safe and enjoyable weekend. School busses and white district vans will continue delivering grab-and-go meals for students this week through Thursday. As a friendly safety reminder, please ensure that adults and children wear masks or face coverings when picking up the grab-and-go student meals.

An updated art lesson is available on our district website for all students and their families called, "Paint Chip Collage.” Go to pvusd.us and click the link entitled, "Virtual Arts Lesson for All".

Today, an elementary math packet was sent out with our grab-and-go meals. The packet can also be accessed on our district website under the learning schedules tab. We ask that our students read every day and that families have students discuss their reading with them.

Please visit our PVUSD Facebook page and “like” and follow us. You can find a direct link to our Facebook page on our district website.

Stay hydrated, stay in place, and make sure to cover your face.

Thank you,

PVUSD Cabinet Administration

post_text:
Greetings from Palo Verde Unified School District,

A reminder to Palo Verde High School students that your Week 1 extra credit projects are due on Friday by 3 p.m. The projects can help raise your third quarter grade and do not count against you.

For 11th grade students at Twin Palms Continuation High School, your credit recovery packets will be handed out this Thursday, April 23rd from 2:00 - 3:00 pm, in front of Twin Palms High School.

Elementary learning packets for English Language-Arts were distributed today with student grab-and-go meals. The next elementary learning packet will be distributed on Thursday.

A reminder that student grab-and-go meals will be distributed for the remainder of the week on Wednesday and Thursday, with Thursday’s meals to include meals for Friday as well.

PVUSD students, keep reading every day.

Have a sensational evening!

Palo Verde Unified School District Administration

Happy Thursday, Palo Verde Unified families!

On Monday, April 20th, there will be updated learning schedules and activities for students on our district website. On Tuesday, April 21st, hard copies of the learning schedules and activities will be handed out with the grab and go lunches. We encourage students to participate with the learning schedules and grade level enrichment activities.

Grab and go lunches will be provided on Monday for students. Grab and Go meals will be distributed Monday through Thursday of next week.

May you all be safe and have a wonderful evening.

Palo Verde Unified School District Administration

post_text:
Greetings PVUSD families,

Happy Spring break to all. We hope students are enjoying their learning projects.

Tomorrow, April 15th, student grab and go lunches will include meals for three days: Wednesday, Thursday and Friday, April 15th, 16th and 17th. Meals will be delivered by our white district vans and by our school busses. We want you to be aware that a white van with our school district logo may be dropping off school meals at different bus stop locations.

We appreciate all the good work by our PVUSD staff providing meals and learning activities for our students. Thanks so much for all you do. PVUSD staff will see you tomorrow for our grab and go meals at the regular times and locations.

Have a great Tuesday!

Palo Verde Unified School District Administration

Here is a link for those of you who wish to watch tonight's PVUSD's Board of Trustees meeting from the comfort of your own home. Meeting starts at 5:30 p.m. with roll call, and any comments submitted will be read. The Board of Trustees will then go into closed session until 6:00 p.m. when the open session portion of the meeting begins.

post_text:
Greetings Community,

The Palo Verde Unified School District is seeking volunteers to assist us as we work to sustain our child nutrition and student learning programs. In an effort to develop a volunteer team, the District created a short application/survey to help recruit the support needed to maintain these important programs. The following link will take you to the District's volunteer application/survey. Please take a moment to complete the survey if you are interested in volunteering for the District during this time. The most common activities may include support with packaging and delivering student meals and/or assisting the District with the distribution of instructional materials.

PVUSD appreciates the support of our community.

https://forms.gle/E2NjYeiaop5gQivA8
